intro: Aiphanes stergiosii, commonly known as the Stergiosii papyrus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is native to the coastal regions of southern Africa, particularly in Namibia and Angola. This plant is characterized by its tall, grass-like stems and dense, sword-shaped leaves that form a rosette at the base. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are clustered in spikelets, typical of the Cyperaceae family. Aiphanes stergiosii is adapted to saline and coastal environments, making it an important component of coastal vegetation in its native range.
